alert.note: Alert for Oahu in Honolulu (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 04 at 10:24AM HST until February 04 at 11:45AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM HST THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF OAHU IN HONOLULU COUNTY... At 1024 AM HST, radar and rain gages indicated heavy rainfall continuing over Oahu. Rain rates were 1 to 3 inches over the central Koolau Range and leeward Oahu from Ewa to Nanakuli. Several gages showed significant rises in water levels, including Waiahole Stream, Moanalua Stream, and Kalihi Stream. Heavy rainfall may continue into the afternoon hours. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. This warning includes the entire island of Oahu. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of drainage ditches and streams, streets, highways, properties, and other low lying spots. Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
